Title: Product ID
Explanation: consisting of a letter L, M, or H for low (50% of all products), medium (30%) and high (20%) as product quality variants and a variant-specific serial number

Title: Type
Explanation: just the product type L, M or H from column 2

Title: Air temperature [K]
Explanation: generated using a random walk process later normalized to a standard deviation of 2 K around 300 K

Title: Process temperature [K]
Explanation: generated using a random walk process normalized to a standard deviation of 1 K, added to the air temperature plus 10 K.

Title: Rotational speed [rpm]
Explanation: calculated from a power of 2860 W, overlaid with a normally distributed noise

Title: Torque [Nm]
Explanation: torque values are normally distributed around 40 Nm with a SD = 10 Nm and no negative values.

Title: Tool wear [min]
Explanation: The quality variants H/M/L add 5/3/2 minutes of tool wear to the used tool in the process.

Title: Machine failure
Explanation: a 'machine failure' label that indicates, whether the machine has failed in this particular datapoint for any of the following failure modes are true.

Title: TWF
Explanation: the tool will be replaced of fail at a randomly selected tool wear time between 200 - 240 mins (120 times in our dataset). At this point in time, the tool is replaced 69 times, and fails 51 times (randomly assigned).

Title: HDF
Explanation: heat dissipation causes a process failure, if the difference between air- and process temperature is below 8.6 K and the tools rotational speed is below 1380 rpm. This is the case for 115 data points.

Title: PWF
Explanation: the product of torque and rotational speed (in rad/s) equals the power required for the process. If this power is below 3500 W or above 9000 W, the process fails, which is the case 95 times in our dataset.

Title: OSF
Explanation: if the product of tool wear and torque exceeds 11,000 minNm for the L product variant (12,000 M, 13,000 H), the process fails due to overstrain. This is true for 98 datapoints.

Title: RNF
Explanation: each process has a chance of 0,1 % to fail regardless of its process parameters. This is the case for only 5 datapoints, less than could be expected for 10,000 datapoints in our dataset.
